result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia O. Leonard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution ($1,962.64) paid in full by co-defendant.

AODA evaluation and followthrough.
Absolute sobriety.
Any counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Carl or Rhonda K. or their residence.
Full time employment (30 hrs/wk) or 10 job searches per month.
Evaluation for use of Naltrexone.
Is eligible for ERP but not to be released before 12/25/19.

Defendant Patricia O. Leonard in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI completed and reviewed by all parties.  Victim Rhonda K. makes a statement directed toward defendant.  Arguments by DA Niemi.  Restittution order submitted.  Jane Krueger-Smith and defendant make statements.  Firearm and voting restrictions noted.  Court sentences defendant to 8 years (4 confinement + 4 ES) with conditions.  Appeal rights.

No contact with victims CK and RK or their home and lot at 404 E Main Street in Bowler.  Limit contact with co-defendant Holly Messer to extent possible in jail.

Defendant Patricia O. Leonard in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-sentence investigation has been filed.  Atty Malcore requests to be allowed to withdraw due to breakdown in communication.  Her defendant is not competent in attorney.  Haven't been able to reach attorney since plea hearing.  Per Atty Malcore not really any fault of the defendant.  Brief comment from Atty Niemi.  Highly unusual request at this point, however, Judge will allow Atty to withdraw.  Atty Malcore to notify PD office for new attorney.  Judge increases cash bond to $25,000.  Defendant taken into custody today.  Review scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 08:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on April 11, 2017 at 10:30 am.
